name: Radisson Blu Scandinavia Hotel, Oslo

reviews.text: After running Holmenkollstafetten, the worlds largest relay race, we checked in at the Hotel 6 pm only to discover that our room was not cleaned after the previous inhabitant. The staff was not willing to give us a new room, and it took 3 calls to the reception and 1 1/2 hour wait to get our room. And guess what? For compensation all they would give us was a bottle of Pepsi and water. Our only and last stay at this hotel, don't bother to try it
reviews.title: [--] Hotel With unpleasant staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had been on a 17 Day Transatlantic cruise with Royal Carribean and got off in Oslo and stayed for 2 nights at the Radisonn Blu Hotel and was very pleased. The hotel was in a great location with a wonderful breakfast buffet which was included in the price. We were very happy with our accomodations and would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling to Oslo. We found Oslo to be very expensive compared to the other ports that we had visited on our cruise but the room rate that we found online for the Radisonn was very reasonable in comparison to other hotels that we had looked at.
reviews.title: Radisonn Blu in Oslo

reviews.text: The room was clean, the free internet connect fast and good, beds were comfortable. The in house restaurant and bar are good and the Staff were very attentive. I stayed only one night on business - the hotel served its purpose but it was not memorable. The bus service from the Airport to the Hotel front door is a definite plus - cost in April 2013 NOK150.00
reviews.title: Efficient, functional and clean

reviews.text: After reading review on here, I agree with everyone the rooms are outdated but they are still clean and serve there purpose, all the staff was very friendly and helpful, the meeting rooms were mostly new compared to the hotel, very central and easy for parking in town so I would recommend to anyone this hotel
reviews.title: Outdated but good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night with my boyfriend. The room was of good size, everything seemed clean and new. They charged us for 1450,- NOK, which is about 30% more than other hotels in Oslo with the same standard. So I expected more, and in stead we got an ok room in an ok hotel - nothing special.
reviews.title: Pricey, random, and a bookring Sunday breakfast

reviews.text: My review is based on a One-Night Stay.
reviews.title: Central but....

reviews.text: Arriving is as walking into a central station - this Hotel is right in the center of Oslo but seem to be a magnet to Bus Tours!
reviews.title: Nice hotel but the customer service isn't what I expect from a Radisson

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's crowded like a Hostel in Berlin or Paris.
reviews.title: Not bad value, rooms a bit small, breakfast crowded

reviews.text: The Bar is packed with drunken Guests and Bypassers (its in the middle of the Lobby -so no escape).
reviews.title: nice but expensive

reviews.text: On the Top-Floor is a/ the Skybar - so the higher your room is - the better the view but the louder it gets - people in Norway seem to drink, drink, drink.......
reviews.title: Terrible Rooms, Arrogant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on 4th floor. Once we opened the door we were immediately concerned with how hot the room was. We set the aircondition to like 18 degrees C, and went out to dinner hoping it would be better when we came back. It wasnt. We opened the tiny window to let in some air. Didnt help anything even though it was cool outside. On top of this the WIFI didnt work either (however that got fixed later on).
reviews.title: Way too hot rooms, problems with WIFI

reviews.text: After a sleepless night i complained about the hot room, and was told the AC was not working, but it would be fixed some time during the day. After a long day out we came back to find the AC still not working. I told the receptionist that this was unacceptable and i wanted at least a partial refund or some other form of compensation, and was told the Service Manager would call me. The call never came, We got offered a table fan which helped only marginally. We had another sleepless night.
reviews.title: Shabby,dated, overpriced and overcharged

reviews.text: The day after we checked out and i immediately sent an email with a complaint to the Service Manager, but i have yet to see any kind of reply to this (2 days ago).
reviews.title: Good Hotel and great value for Norway

reviews.text: Other than this the rooms were ok, if perhaps a bit small. The rooms clearly show signs of ageing though. The bathroom has a bathtub/shower combo which i strongly dislike, however thats a matter of taste. The hotel breakfast was good, with a good variety of choices and very good coffee.
reviews.title: No aircondition, hot rooms
Awesome view in room 2212
reviews.text: All this said, overall the main point of a hotel is to have a room to sleep in at night. A hotel room where you cannot sleep looses its point. Terrible experience i would not recommend to anyone, and will not go back there myself.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good for the Flybussen from the airport as it stops outside. Acceptable bedroom - like all norwegian hotels no extras like tissues - breakfast was good but although paid for they did not serve early enough for us to have it on the day we departed. THey did have coffee and tea in teh recpetion area wihvc was something. Can walk most places. from this destiantion. Limited information - you cannot buy the Oslo Pass anywhere but the visitor centre (everyone tried to sell us travel cards but as we knew the price we declined) However Oslo and Norway generally seems to close at Easter so perhaps the more informed people were not available.
reviews.title: Convenient Location

reviews.text: WE turned the heating off and were comfortable although there was snow on the ground as it was warm enough.
reviews.title: Slowmotion, dont get caught in recepsion and like the hint of smoking

reviews.text: Although we had a doulbe room there was only one single duvet and had to ask for a second the following morning - our fault we did not notice ! But that should not happen. The doors opened outwards which was different !
reviews.title: Decent, basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This used to be one of the better hotels in Oslo where you always expected high class service and experience. Not so anymore... Ok with that, it is starting to get old and I expect that they will do some refurbishing sooner or later. If you don't smoke, you chose to get a non smoker room, but... it is still there, even if someone haven't smoked there for a while. Spoke to at least 4 or 5 persons this evening who complained abouth the same thing. What really anoyes me is the constant queue in the reception and th level of the people working there. It seems that most of them were apprentices and the people that could help them were most of the time hiding in the back office. When there are a queue of more then 4-5 persons in line, you get more staff. They could do a trip to same owners hotel Plaza where the reception is always handled ok and learn something.
reviews.title: It's fine - just needs some TLC

reviews.text: No, we prefer the Plaza
reviews.title: Raddisson Blu Scandinavia Oslo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A warm welcome in the reception and then awaited the superior room... Well, the view is amazing, but the decor is so outdated. And the room is small too. I'd expected more for a superior room. Separate beds pushed together is neither gives you a good night sleep as a couple.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast hall is huge and was so full they had even opened a spare "extra" room for the guests. There we found a table - finally and that room was freezing. Commented by all the guests who ended up there... Further where the food where, it was quite messy and quickly empty and then bad looking. The waiters worked slow and badly organized, no one seemed to clean around the food plates nor the tables..
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: A poor experience...
reviews.title: OK for a night or two
Great hotel
reviews.text: Heads up to the sky bar btw - take a drink and enjoy the view.

Bus from airport stops outside hotel which was beneficial, nice ambience to hotel, room large and good bathroom. Breakfast included with booking , free wifi, bar on top level, with magnificient views of Oslo , worth staying at this hotel
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Good Value, read on for more...

reviews.text: My employer paid for my room (approximately $250/night) or I would not have stayed in a place in this price range. Even so, I was surprised that the room was rough around the edges. I was expecting something much fancier - like a high end Hyatt at least. This was more like a slightly run down Sheraton. Part of this of course is my own lack of understanding just how little you get for your money in this country. This hotel was held in high regard by my local colleagues so perhaps it is one of the better ones, despite the fact that it is showing its age.
reviews.title: Not a good value; rooms showing their age. Great rooftop bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, the heat was out of control (coming from outside the room as my thermostat was not on) and I could not reduce it to an acceptable point. However I was able to crack a window which solved the problem.
reviews.title: The home away from home!

reviews.text: The breakfast is great as it often the case at Norwegian hotels. If you have never been up here you really need to experience a hotel breakfast in this country. Its remarkable with a huge selection of items.
reviews.title: Best Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel bar has a fantastic view of the city from the 20+ floor. There were some local people just enjoying the bar when I was there (paying $15 per beer).
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel is 3 blocks from the NationalTheater train station where the FlytoGet airport train stops. If this is your first time in Oslo do not make the mistake of taking a taxi - It can easily cost you $200.
reviews.title: You could do worse than this hotel in Oslo

reviews.text: The hotel has beautiful rooms.. good Location.. and very friendly staff! Been staying at this hotel many many times and never dissapointed.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: U wont go wrong staying here!
reviews.title: Great location and nice facilities

reviews.text: This hotel is located in the heart of Oslo. The business rooms are good - new bathrooms, and generally just nice. The restaurant in the lobby is very good - however also expensive like anything else in Norway. Generally this Radisson hotel is completely at the well known Radisson standard. You know what you get. In the basement you will find an exellent fitness room with everything you would expect and a good indoor swimming pool. I have actually completely forgiven that they forgot to clean my room one day during my stay. ;o)
reviews.title: Outdated rooms for a High Price

reviews.text: I stayed at the Radisson Blu Scandinavia hotel in March 2012 for 1 night.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: This hotel has one of the best locations downtown Oslo, located right next to the Royal Palace. You'll find lots of cafe/restaurants/nightlife within a 10-15 min walk and transportation, both local & regional, is located within 5 min walk from the hotel. I stayed in a newly refurbished business room, but all business rooms include a Nespresso machine as well as free premium movies etc.
reviews.title: Excellent location in Oslo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is very professional and helpful, which makes the stay very comfortable.
reviews.title: Good choice for a hotel in Oslo

reviews.text: My wife and me stayed for one night at this hotel. After reading other Tripadvisor reviews we asked to be moved from our assigned smoking room at 21st floor at check in due to the possible noise from the night club located on the same floor. In stead we got a spacious, recently and very nicely refurbished non-smoking room at third floor, with direct access to the terrace.
reviews.title: A bit above average

reviews.text: Great location, great room and a great selection of breakfast dishes. I couldn't ask for more.
reviews.title: Better than before

reviews.text: Has stayed at this hotel many times before, but now it was some time ago. I had a refurbished room, a bit small but OK. Room was clean, bed was good and breakfast was good. Only complaint is there was only one employee at the desk at cheque-in and out, so it was rather slow.
reviews.title: Well past its glamour time!
